ã„ã‚„ãï¼Œä¸¦è¡Œå‡¦ç†æ›¸ãã®ä¹…ã—ã¶ã‚Šã§ï¼Œè‰²ã€…ã¨ãƒã‚°ã‚’æ½°ã—ã¦ãŸã‚‰ v1.3.2 ã¾ã§ä¸ŠãŒã£ã¦ã—ã¾ã£ãŸï¼ˆç¬‘ï¼‰

package main

import (
    "fmt"
    "sync"

    "github.com/goark/errs"
)

func generateMultiError() error {
    errlist := &errs.Errors{}
    var wg sync.WaitGroup
    for i := 1; i <= 2; i++ {
        i := i
        wg.Add(1)
        go func() {
            defer wg.Done()
            errlist.Add(fmt.Errorf("error %d", i))
        }()
    }
    wg.Wait()
    return errlist.ErrorOrNil()
}

func main() {
    err := generateMultiError()
    fmt.Printf("%+v\n", err) // {"Type":"*errs.Errors","Errs":[{"Type":"*errors.errorString","Msg":"error 2"},{"Type":"*errors.errorString","Msg":"error 1"}]}
}

package main

import (
    "errors"
    "fmt"
    "io"
    "os"

    "github.com/goark/errs"
)

func generateMultiError() error {
    return errs.Join(os.ErrInvalid, io.EOF)
}

func main() {
    err := generateMultiError()
    fmt.Printf("%+v\n", err)            // {"Type":"*errs.Errors","Errs":[{"Type":"*errors.errorString","Msg":"invalid argument"},{"Type":"*errors.errorString","Msg":"EOF"}]}
    fmt.Println(errors.Is(err, io.EOF)) // true
}

package main

import (
    "errors"
    "fmt"
    "io"
    "os"

    "github.com/goark/errs"
)

func generateMultiError() error {
    return errs.New("error with multiple causes", errs.WithCause(errors.Join(os.ErrInvalid, io.EOF)))
}

func main() {
    err := generateMultiError()
    fmt.Println(errors.Is(err, io.EOF)) // true
}

func Unwraps(err error) []error {
    if err != nil {
        if es, ok := err.(interface {
            Unwrap() []error
        }); ok {
            return es.Unwrap()
        }
    }
    e := errors.Unwrap(err)
    if e != nil {
        return []error{e}
    }
    return nil
}

entry.content:
ãŠãã‚‰ã 2022-02 ã«ãƒªãƒªãƒ¼ã‚¹ã•ã‚Œã‚‹ Go 1.20 ã§ errors ãƒ‘ãƒƒã‚±ãƒ¼ã‚¸ã®ä»•æ§˜ãŒå¤‰ã‚ã‚‹ã¿ãŸã„ãªã®ã§äºˆç¿’ã—ã¦ãŠãã€‚

ç¾è¡Œã® errors.Is() ãŠã‚ˆã³ errors.As() å„é–¢æ•°ã§ã¯ å¯¾è±¡ã¨ãªã‚‹ error ã‚¤ãƒ³ã‚¹ã‚¿ãƒ³ã‚¹ã«ã¤ã„ã¦å‹ã‚¢ã‚µãƒ¼ã‚·ãƒ§ãƒ³ã‚’è¡Œã„ Unwrap() error ãƒ¡ã‚½ãƒƒãƒ‰ã‚’å«ã‚€å‹ã‹å¦ã‹ã§å†å¸°çš„ã«å‡¦ç†ã‚’è¡Œã£ã¦ã„ã‚‹ãŒï¼Œ Go 1.20 ã‹ã‚‰ã¯ï¼Œã“ã®è©•ä¾¡ã« Unwrap() []error ãƒ¡ã‚½ãƒƒãƒ‰ãŒåŠ ã‚ã‚‹ã€‚

å…·ä½“çš„ã«ã¯ã“ã‚“ãªæ„Ÿã˜ã‚‰ã—ã„ã€‚

// Is reports whether any error in err's tree matches target.
//
// The tree consists of err itself, followed by the errors obtained by repeatedly
// calling Unwrap. When err wraps multiple errors, Is examines err followed by a
// depth-first traversal of its children.
//
// An error is considered to match a target if it is equal to that target or if
// it implements a method Is(error) bool such that Is(target) returns true.
//
// An error type might provide an Is method so it can be treated as equivalent
// to an existing error. For example, if MyError defines
//
//    func (m MyError) Is(target error) bool { return target == fs.ErrExist }
//
// then Is(MyError{}, fs.ErrExist) returns true. See syscall.Errno.Is for
// an example in the standard library. An Is method should only shallowly
// compare err and the target and not call Unwrap on either.
func Is(err, target error) bool {
    if target == nil {
        return err == target
    }

    isComparable := reflectlite.TypeOf(target).Comparable()
    for {
        if isComparable && err == target {
            return true
        }
        if x, ok := err.(interface{ Is(error) bool }); ok && x.Is(target) {
            return true
        }
        switch x := err.(type) {
        case interface{ Unwrap() error }:
            err = x.Unwrap()
            if err == nil {
                return false
            }
        case interface{ Unwrap() []error }:
            for _, err := range x.Unwrap() {
                if Is(err, target) {
                    return true
                }
            }
            return false
        default:
            return false
        }
    }
}

// As finds the first error in err's tree that matches target, and if one is found, sets
// target to that error value and returns true. Otherwise, it returns false.
//
// The tree consists of err itself, followed by the errors obtained by repeatedly
// calling Unwrap. When err wraps multiple errors, As examines err followed by a
// depth-first traversal of its children.
//
// An error matches target if the error's concrete value is assignable to the value
// pointed to by target, or if the error has a method As(interface{}) bool such that
// As(target) returns true. In the latter case, the As method is responsible for
// setting target.
//
// An error type might provide an As method so it can be treated as if it were a
// different error type.
//
// As panics if target is not a non-nil pointer to either a type that implements
// error, or to any interface type.
func As(err error, target any) bool {
    if err == nil {
        return false
    }
    if target == nil {
        panic("errors: target cannot be nil")
    }
    val := reflectlite.ValueOf(target)
    typ := val.Type()
    if typ.Kind() != reflectlite.Ptr || val.IsNil() {
        panic("errors: target must be a non-nil pointer")
    }
    targetType := typ.Elem()
    if targetType.Kind() != reflectlite.Interface && !targetType.Implements(errorType) {
        panic("errors: *target must be interface or implement error")
    }
    for {
        if reflectlite.TypeOf(err).AssignableTo(targetType) {
            val.Elem().Set(reflectlite.ValueOf(err))
            return true
        }
        if x, ok := err.(interface{ As(any) bool }); ok && x.As(target) {
            return true
        }
        switch x := err.(type) {
        case interface{ Unwrap() error }:
            err = x.Unwrap()
            if err == nil {
                return false
            }
        case interface{ Unwrap() []error }:
            for _, err := range x.Unwrap() {
                if As(err, target) {
                    return true
                }
            }
            return false
        default:
            return false
        }
    }
}

entry.content:
ä»Šæ—¥ã®èµ·ç‚¹ã¨ãªã‚‹ã‚³ãƒ¼ãƒ‰ã¯ã“ã‚Œã«ã—ã‚ˆã†ã€‚

fn parse_string(s: &str) -> Result<u32, std::num::ParseIntError> {
    s.parse::<u32>()
}

fn main() {
    println!("{:?}", parse_string("-1")); //Output: Err(ParseIntError { kind: InvalidDigit })
}

parse_string() é–¢æ•°ã®è¿”ã‚Šå€¤ã®å‹ Result ã¯åˆ—æŒ™å‹ enum ã§1ï¼Œä»¥ä¸‹ã®2ã¤ã®åˆ—æŒ™å­ï¼ˆvariantï¼‰ã§æ§‹æˆã•ã‚Œã¦ã„ã‚‹ã€‚

enum Result<T, E> {
    Ok(T),
    Err(E),
}

Result ãªã©åˆ—æŒ™å‹ã®è©•ä¾¡ã«ã¯ match å¼ã‚’ä½¿ã†ã€‚ ãŸã¨ãˆã° parse() ã«å¤±æ•—ã—ãŸéš›ã« 0 ã‚’ã‚»ãƒƒãƒˆã—ãŸã„ãªã‚‰

fn main() {
    let n = match parse_string("-1") {
        Ok(x) => x,
        Err(_) => 0,
    };
    println!("{}", n); //Output: 0
}

ãªã©ã¨æ›¸ãã“ã¨ãŒã§ãã‚‹ã€‚

Result å‹ã‚’ä½¿ã£ãŸã‚¨ãƒ©ãƒ¼ãƒ»ãƒãƒ³ãƒ‰ãƒªãƒ³ã‚°

ã“ã®ã‚ˆã†ã« Result å‹ã‚’ä½¿ã†ã“ã¨ã§åŸºæœ¬çš„ãªã‚¨ãƒ©ãƒ¼ãƒ»ãƒãƒ³ãƒ‰ãƒªãƒ³ã‚°ãŒå¯èƒ½ã«ãªã‚‹ã€‚ ã„ãã¤ã‹ä¾‹ã‚’æŒ™ã’ã¦ã„ã“ã†ã€‚

Panic ã‚’æŠ•ã’ã‚‹

parse_string() é–¢æ•°ãŒ Err ã‚’è¿”ã—ãŸå ´åˆã«å¼·åˆ¶çµ‚äº†ã—ãŸã„ã®ã§ã‚ã‚Œã°

fn main() {
    let n = match parse_string("-1") {
        Ok(x) => x,
        Err(e) => panic!(e), //Output: thread 'main' panicked at 'Box<Any>', src/main.rs:8:19
    };
    println!("{}", n); //do not reach
}

ã¨ panic! ãƒã‚¯ãƒ­ã§ panic ã‚’æŠ•ã’ã‚Œã°ã‚ˆã„ã€‚ ã¡ãªã¿ã«ï¼Œç’°å¢ƒå¤‰æ•° RUST_BACKTRACE ã« 1 ã‚’ã‚»ãƒƒãƒˆã™ã‚‹ã¨ panic æ™‚ã«ã‚¹ã‚¿ãƒƒã‚¯ãƒˆãƒ¬ãƒ¼ã‚¹æƒ…å ±ã‚‚åãã€‚

å˜ã« panic ã‚’æŠ•ã’ã‚Œã°ã„ã„ã®ã§ã‚ã‚Œã° Result::unwrap() ãƒ¡ã‚½ãƒƒãƒ‰ã‚’ä½¿ãˆã°ä¸Šè¿°ã®ã‚³ãƒ¼ãƒ‰ã¨ã»ã¼åŒã˜çµæœãŒå¾—ã‚‰ã‚Œã‚‹ã€‚

fn main() {

    println!("{}", n); //do not reach
}

Panic ã‚’æŠ•ã’ã‚‹éš›ã®ãƒ¡ãƒƒã‚»ãƒ¼ã‚¸ã‚’æŒ‡å®šã™ã‚‹ã«ã¯ Result::expect() ãƒ¡ã‚½ãƒƒãƒ‰ã‚’ä½¿ã†ã€‚

fn main() {
    let n = parse_string("-1").expect("error in parse_string() function"); //Output: thread 'main' panicked at 'error in parse_string() function: ParseIntError { kind: InvalidDigit }', src/main.rs:6:13
    println!("{}", n); //do not reach
}

Panic ä»¥å¤–ã®ãƒãƒ³ãƒ‰ãƒªãƒ³ã‚°

ã‚¨ãƒ©ãƒ¼æ™‚ã«å˜ã« panic ã‚’æŠ•ã’ã‚‹ã®ã§ã¯ãªãï¼Œä½•ã‚‰ã‹ã®å‡¦ç†ã‚’è¡Œã£ã¦æ™®é€šã«ãƒ—ãƒ­ã‚»ã‚¹ã‚’çµ‚äº†ã—ãŸã„ã®ã§ã‚ã‚Œã° Result::unwrap_or_else() ãƒ¡ã‚½ãƒƒãƒ‰ã‚’ä½¿ã£ã¦

fn main() {
    let n = parse_string("-1").unwrap_or_else(|e| {
        println!("Error in parse_string() function: {:?}", e); //Output: Error in parse_string() function: ParseIntError { kind: InvalidDigit }
        std::process::exit(1);
    });
    println!("{}", n); //do not reach
}

ãªã©ã¨ã™ã‚‹ã“ã¨ã‚‚ã§ãã‚‹ã€‚ ãƒ—ãƒ­ã‚»ã‚¹ã‚’çµ‚äº†ã™ã‚‹ã®ã§ã¯ãªãï¼Œæœ€åˆã®ä¾‹ã®ã‚ˆã†ã«è§£æå¤±æ•—æ™‚ã« 0 ã‚’ã‚»ãƒƒãƒˆã—ãŸã„ãªã‚‰

fn main() {

    println!("{}", n); //Output: 0
}

ã¦ãªæ„Ÿã˜ã«ã‚‚æ›¸ã‘ã‚‹ã€‚ ã‚ã‚‹ã„ã¯ã‚‚ã£ã¨ç°¡å˜ã« Result::unwrap_or() ãƒ¡ã‚½ãƒƒãƒ‰ã‚’ä½¿ã£ã¦

ã¨ã‚‚æ›¸ã‘ã‚‹ã€‚

ã‚¨ãƒ©ãƒ¼ã®å§”è­²

æ¬¡ã«ä»¥ä¸‹ã®é–¢æ•°ã‚’è€ƒãˆã‚‹ã€‚ 2ã¤ã®æ•°æ–‡å­—åˆ—ã‚’ä¸ãˆã¦çµ„ï¼ˆtupleï¼‰ã«ã—ã¦è¿”ã™ã€‚

fn parse_pair_strings(s1: &str, s2: &str) -> Result<(u32, u32), std::num::ParseIntError> {
    let x = match s1.parse::<u32>() {
        Ok(n) => n,
        Err(e) => return Err(e),
    };
    let y = match s2.parse::<u32>() {
        Ok(n) => n,
        Err(e) => return Err(e),
    };
    Ok((x, y))
}

fn main() {
    println!("{:?}", parse_pair_strings("1", "-1")); //Output: Err(ParseIntError { kind: InvalidDigit })
}

parse_pair_strings() ã®ä»®å¼•æ•° s1 ãŠã‚ˆã³ s2 ã«å¯¾ã—ã¦ãã‚Œãã‚Œ parse() ã‚’è¡Œã†ã®ã ãŒï¼Œè¿”ã‚Šå€¤ãŒ Err ã®éš›ã«ã¯ã‚¨ãƒ©ãƒ¼ã‚’ãã®ã¾ã¾è¿”ã—ã¦å‘¼ã³å‡ºã—å…ƒã«ãƒãƒ³ãƒ‰ãƒªãƒ³ã‚°ã‚’å§”è­²ã—ã¦ã„ã‚‹ã€‚

è¿”ã‚Šå€¤ã®å‹ãŒåŒã˜ Result ãªã‚‰ ? æ¼”ç®—å­ã‚’ä½¿ã£ã¦ã‚¨ãƒ©ãƒ¼ã®å§”è­²ã‚’ã‚‚ã£ã¨ç°¡å˜ã«æ›¸ãã“ã¨ãŒã§ãã‚‹ã€‚ ã“ã‚“ãªæ„Ÿã˜ã€‚

fn parse_pair_strings(s1: &str, s2: &str) -> Result<(u32, u32), std::num::ParseIntError> {
    Ok((s1.parse::<u32>()?, s2.parse::<u32>()?))
}

ã™ã£ãã‚Šãƒ¼ï¼

ã‚¨ãƒ©ãƒ¼ã®æ±åŒ–

ä»Šåº¦ã¯ï¼Œå¼•æ•°ã«æ–‡å­—åˆ—ã‚’æ¸¡ã™ã®ã§ã¯ãªãï¼Œæ¨™æº–å…¥åŠ›ã‹ã‚‰æ–‡å­—åˆ—ã‚’å–å¾—ã—ã¦ parse() ã—ã¦ã¿ã‚ˆã†ã€‚

fn parse_from_stdin() -> Result<u32, std::num::ParseIntError> {
    let mut buf = String::new();
    std::io::stdin().read_line(&mut buf)?; //Compile error: `?` couldn't convert the error to `std::num::ParseIntError`
    buf.trim().parse::<u32>()
}

å½“ç„¶ãªãŒã‚‰ã“ã‚Œã¯ã‚³ãƒ³ãƒ‘ã‚¤ãƒ«ã‚¨ãƒ©ãƒ¼ã«ãªã‚‹ã€‚ ä½•æ•…ãªã‚‰ read_line() é–¢æ•°ã§ã¯ Err ã®å€¤ãŒ std::io::Error å‹ã«ãªã‚‹ã®ã§ std::num::ParseIntError å‹ã¨ã¯ãƒãƒƒãƒã—ãªã„ãŸã‚ã ã€‚

ã“ã‚Œã‚’è§£æ±ºã™ã‚‹ã«ã¯ std::error::Error å‹ã‚’æ±åŒ–å‹ã¨ã—ã¦ä½¿ãˆã°ã‚ˆã„ã€‚

std::error::Error å‹ã‚’ä½¿ã†éš›ã¯ Box<dyn Trait> ã«ã™ã‚‹ã‚ˆã†ã ã€‚ ã“ã‚“ãªæ„Ÿã˜ã€‚

fn parse_from_stdin() -> Result<u32, Box<dyn std::error::Error>> {
    let mut buf = String::new();
    std::io::stdin().read_line(&mut buf)?;
    let n = buf.trim().parse::<u32>()?;
    Ok(n)
}

fn main() {
    println!("{:?}", parse_from_stdin());
}

å®Ÿè¡Œã™ã‚‹ã¨ã“ã‚“ãªæ„Ÿã˜ã«ãªã‚‹ã€‚

$ echo -1 | cargo run
Err(ParseIntError { kind: InvalidDigit })

main() é–¢æ•°å´ã§ã‚‚ã†å°‘ã—ç´°ã‹ãã‚¨ãƒ©ãƒ¼ã‚’è¦‹ã¦ã¿ã‚ˆã†ã€‚ ã“ã‚“ãªæ„Ÿã˜ã‹ãªãã€‚

fn main() {
    let n = match parse_from_stdin() {
        Ok(x) => x,
        Err(err) => {
            match err.downcast_ref::<std::io::Error>() {
                Some(e) => {
                    println!("io::Error in parse_from_stdin(): {}", e);
                    std::process::exit(1);
                }
                _ => (),
            };
            match err.downcast_ref::<std::num::ParseIntError>() {
                Some(e) => {
                    println!("ParseIntError in parse_from_stdin(): {}", e);
                    std::process::exit(1);
                }
                _ => (),
            };
            println!("Other error in parse_from_stdin(): {}", err);
            std::process::exit(1);
        }
    };
    println!("{}", n);
}

ã“ã†ã™ã‚Œã° Box<dyn std::error::Error> å‹ã‹ã‚‰ã‚‚ã¨ã®ã‚¨ãƒ©ãƒ¼å‹ã‚’æŠ½å‡ºã—ã¦å€‹åˆ¥ã«å‡¦ç†ã§ããã†ã€‚ ã“ã‚Œã‚’å®Ÿè¡Œã™ã‚‹ã¨ã“ã‚“ãªæ„Ÿã˜ã€‚

$ echo -1 | cargo run
ParseIntError in parse_from_stdin(): invalid digit found in string

ã‚“ãƒ¼ã€‚ ã‹ãªã‚Šé¢å€’ãã•ã„ãªã€‚ ã‚‚ã†å°‘ã—ãƒã‚·ãªæˆ¦ç•¥ã‚’æ¢ã™ã¹ãã‹ã€‚

Option å‹ã‚’ä½¿ã£ãŸã‚¨ãƒ©ãƒ¼ãƒ»ãƒãƒ³ãƒ‰ãƒªãƒ³ã‚°

ä¸Šè¿°ã®ã‚³ãƒ¼ãƒ‰ã«ã‚ã‚‹ downcast_ref() ãƒ¡ã‚½ãƒƒãƒ‰ã¯ Option å‹ã®å€¤ã‚’è¿”ã™ã€‚ Option å‹ã‚‚åˆ—æŒ™å‹ã§ï¼Œä»¥ä¸‹ã®2ã¤ã®åˆ—æŒ™å­ã§æ§‹æˆã•ã‚Œã¦ã„ã‚‹ã€‚

enum Option<T> {
    Some(T),

}

None ã¯ã„ã‚ã‚†ã‚‹ Null å€¤ï¼Œã¤ã¾ã‚Šå€¤ãŒãªã„ã“ã¨ã‚’ç¤ºã™ã€‚ é–¢æ•°ã®å®Ÿè¡ŒçµæœãŒ Null å€¤ã‚’å–ã‚Šå¾—ã‚‹å ´åˆã« Option å‹ã‚’è¿”ã™ã“ã¨ã§ï¼Œå‘¼ã³å‡ºã—å…ƒã« Null å€¤ã®ãƒãƒ³ãƒ‰ãƒªãƒ³ã‚°ã‚’ä¿ƒã™ã“ã¨ãŒã§ãã‚‹ã€‚

èµ·ç‚¹ã®ã‚³ãƒ¼ãƒ‰ã¯ã“ã‚“ãªæ„Ÿã˜ã§ã©ã†ã ã‚ã†ã‹ã€‚

fn main() {
    let nihongo = "æ—¥æœ¬èª";
    for i in 0..4 {
        println!("{}: {:?}", i, nihongo.chars().nth(i));
    }
}

å®Ÿè¡Œã™ã‚‹ã¨ã“ã‚“ãªæ„Ÿã˜ã«ãªã‚‹ã€‚

$ cargo run
0: Some('æ—¥')
1: Some('æœ¬')
2: Some('èª')

Panic ã‚’æŠ•ã’ã‚‹

çµæœãŒ None ãªã‚‰ panic ã‚’æŠ•ã’ã‚‹ã‚ˆã†ã«ã—ã¦ã¿ã‚‹ã€‚

fn main() {
    let nihongo = "æ—¥æœ¬èª";

å®Ÿè¡Œã™ã‚‹ã¨ã“ã‚“ãªæ„Ÿã˜ã€‚

$ cargo run

1: æœ¬

thread 'main' panicked at 'Out of bounds', src/main.rs:6:21

ã¾ãŸ Option å‹ã«ã‚‚ unwrap() ã‚„ expect() ã¨ã„ã£ãŸãƒ¡ã‚½ãƒƒãƒ‰ãŒã‚ã‚Šï¼Œ None ãŒè¿”ã£ãŸã‚‰ panic ã‚’æŠ•ã’ã‚‹ã€‚

Panic ä»¥å¤–ã®ãƒãƒ³ãƒ‰ãƒªãƒ³ã‚°

ãŸã¨ãˆã°ï¼Œã“ã‚“ãªæ„Ÿã˜ã‹ãªã€‚

ä¸­èº«ã‚’è¦‹ã‚‹ã¨ï¼Œæ¨™æº–ã® errors.Is(), errors.As(), ãŠã‚ˆã³ errors.Unwrap() å„é–¢æ•°ã‚’ç½®ãæ›ãˆå¯èƒ½ã«ãªã£ã¦ã„ã¦ï¼Œã•ã‚‰ã« pkg/errors ã®ç‰¹å¾´ã§ã‚ã‚‹ Cause() é–¢æ•°ã‚‚ä½¿ãˆã‚‹ã‚ˆã†ã«ãªã£ã¦ã„ã‚‹ã€‚

func Cause(err error) error {
    type causer interface {
        Cause() error
    }

    for err != nil {
        if cause, ok := err.(causer); ok {
            err = cause.Cause()
        } else if unwrapped := Unwrap(err); unwrapped != nil {
            err = unwrapped
        } else {
            break
        }
    }
    return err
}
